name: Association for children damaged by hormone pregnancy tests
goal: The Association for children damaged by hormone pregnancy tests represents families who suffered abnormalities, stillbirths and miscarriages, due to taking pregnancy diagnosis tablets. Our goal is to ensure that all members who suffered these injuries are recognised as victims of this drug. Our further activities focus on providing support and regular information along with opportunities for engaging with each other. We are a user-led non profit organisation set up in the UK in 1978 and recognised and governed by the Charities Act (Charity no.: 276658).
interests: Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health
euInitiatives: Health and in particular legislation relating to pharmaceuticals. European Reference Networks for rare diseases - congenital malformations.
